item.description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group offering insurance and wealth management solutions in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia

We are on a transformational journey. We want to remove complexity from the financial services industry, to make people’s lives better by helping to make their decisions easier. Being part of this transformation is hugely exciting and offers talented, ambitious people an amazing opportunity to build a career. If that sounds like you, then we want to hear from you.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Director to join our Advanced Customer Analytics team. Your job will be to execute against our strategy and drive initiatives that improve client experience and outcomes. Your primary responsibility will be researching and developing a global customer analytics record that will be used to insights and develops targeted, digital interventions. 

Who We Are
 

Manulife’s Advanced Customer Analytics team works across our global insurance and wealth management businesses to accelerate the use of Advanced Analytics & AI in understanding the voice of the customer – both what they say and how they interact with us.  With an eye towards creating personalized products and digital service experiences we will play a key role in the organizations commitment to be a digital, customer leader. 
 

What You Will Do

You will be at the center of where Advanced Analytics meets customer experience. As part of a team dedicated to Advanced Customer Analytics, you will help enable predictive servicing solutions, use Natural Language Processing techniques to understand the voice of the customer, experiment with journey analytics to resolve pain points in our online experiences.  You will lead the research and development of a global customer analytics record - the foundation for all other work.

 
The Role Will Be Directly Responsible For

  • Leading the creation of a global customer analytics record encompassing all elements of meaningful customer data, curated for Advanced Analytics & AI use cases

  • Identifying and prioritizing data for ingestion across all customer (and key B2B intermediary) experiences including sales, marketing, operations, web, mobile, call centers, and more.

  • Coordinating with global advanced analytics teams, business stakeholders, and technology teams to facilitate last mile delivery of reusable capabilities that can be easily deployed into new markets

  • Developing creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies

  • Provide thought leadership and drive innovative solutions that influence how data insights are delivered to the client throughout Manulife

Typical Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree with 8+ year’s experience, or Master’s with any of the following fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Math, Engineering, Operation Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields.

Professional Experience may include

  • Advanced skills in modern data architecture, data science engineering, data modeling, data quality and manipulation of structured and unstructured data sources using state-of-the-art cloud computing technologies (Azure)

  • Expertise delivering analytics & machine learning products, with a deep understanding of agile product delivery in an enterprise environment

  • Familiarity with Big Data processing and building Data APIs. Experience with automated data quality frameworks is a plus.

  • Entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to creating rigorous, high-quality insights from data, at scale.

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to engage the enterprise across multiple specializations with analytically backed compelling stories

  • Proven project management and planning skills

  • Prior experience with insurance or financial services is not required

  • Building strong collaborative relationships across different Analytics and business teams during high pressure/fast paced delivery cycles

  • As a member of the US Segment Advanced Analytics leadership team, identifying process enhancements and opportunities to improve our data architecture, analytics/ML tools and practices to enable the team’s efficiency

item.description:

Hybrid

Job Description

The AVP Functions Advanced Analytics & Governance (AVP – Functions AA & Governance) leads a group of teams in applying leading AI/AA technologies in support of Group Functions, governing AI/AA model risk and responsible AI framework, developing AI/AA R&D, while scaling up AI/AA training. AVP – Functions AA & Governance is a leader in managing AI/AA teams and a well-established professional within the AI/AA community; accountable for implementing Manulife’s AI/AA model risk framework and responsible AI framework; while also leading the AI/AA Academy for Executives and broader training initiatives; he/she is a connector who partners closely with CAO leadership in developing business plans in support of the corporate AI/AA Strategies.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Lead and inspire teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers by pushing the boundaries of AI/AA applications in support Manulife’s Group Functions. The levels of team members are from Associate data scientist to Lead Data Scientist

  • Advises and influences Group Functions Executive leadership teams at different levels with leading AI/AA applications and trends, identifying new opportunities to develop solutions while tackling business problems

  • Lead the AI/AA model validation unit to implement the AI/AA Model Risk Framework. Develop Responsible AI framework

  • Lead global AI/AA R&D effort in bringing new methods and practices into Manulife and solving business problems

  • Lead the AI/AA Academy for Executives and broader training initiatives

  • Lead the engagement with academic research institutions and universities

  • Coordinate internal AI/AA knowledge sharing sessions, e.g. Monthly Best Practices, and research workshops with internal and external speakers on selected topics. Actively bridging the gap between the external leading research advances and internal practices

  • Actively engage with AI/AA communities and represent Manulife/John Hancock in AI/AA discussions externally

  • Consistently sees overall picture and alternative approaches; vision of what may be possible

  • Builds support and collaboration by communicating the significant impacts of a decision and sharing a vision of achieving the most favorable outcome

  • Maintains a strong internal network at all levels of the organization. Actively champions a diverse external network of industry/analytics thought leaders

  • Ability to attract outstanding talent to the organization

  • Influences AI/AA and business strategy by contributing ideas that solve meaningful business problems

  • Seen as a thought leader throughout the business. Actively listens to others and ensures all voices are heard

  • Actively seeks out coaching opportunities and incorporates feedback into their work

  • Provides guidance and mentorship to Directors and Data Scientists

  • Promotes best practices within the team, and shares technical expertise with others

  • Incorporates lessons learned throughout the business into their work

Key Shared Accountabilities:

  • Connect closely with executives in Group Functions and collaborate with business teams to develop project opportunities and deliver business solutions

  • Partner with CAO, Segment AI/AA leaderships and Enterprise Model Risk Management to develop and deliver AI/AA governance and training

Job Requirements:

  • Advanced degree in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Actuary or Engineering; PhD is preferred.

  • A track of record in leading AI/AA implementation or other analytical solutions in Finance, Risk or Compliance

  • Comprehensive understanding and experiences in model governance

  • Generally, a minimum of 10 years of applicable experience in quantitative analyses

  • A track of record of dynamic leadership experience in leading AI/AA teams

  • An established expert in AI/AA fields

  • Advanced knowledge of programming languages and concepts (e.g. Python, R or SAS)

  • Specialist in different techniques and knowledge of machine learning algorithms

  • Advanced knowledge of common database querying languages such as SQL; Capability of applying a detailed, structured approach to explore / navigate / mine massive amount of data, structured or un-structured, to uncover hidden patterns / insights

  • Strong ability to identify key Advanced Analytics opportunities in business and deliver results

  • Strong ability to initiate and carry research discussions with academic research communities, convey Manulife’s interest in research agenda and gaining knowledge and collaboration for Manulife’s business

  • Continuous learning

  • Actively monitor new technologies

Decision Authorities:

  • Define AI/AA for Functions strategy and plan according to the overall AI/AA Strategy and roadmap, and deliver results

  • Define responsibilities for teams under his/her supervision.

  • Hiring decisions for levels from J to M for both technical and managerial roles

  • Works on significant and unique challenges in AI/AA fields that hold strategic value to advance Manulife’s business

  • Strong ability to influence leaders and teams in both AI/AA function and business units

Job Description

Senior Data Engineer

Job Description

John Hancock US Data Office is looking for an exceptional data engineer to lead the discovery of hidden information using our massive data and leverage advanced analytics and machine learning techniques to enable data-driven strategic decision making. This role requires broad knowledge of data engineering techniques, familiarity with predictive analytics, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. We’re a lean, flat and experimental team that uses data engineering & analytics to identify and inject high-value insights into business operation. The team works in quick iterations, using cutting edge techniques and algorithms that are best suited for the various challenges, which include but not limited to: sales, distribution, marketing and pricing.


Reporting to the Head of US Data Office, this position will take a leading part in designing and delivering Data Warehouses, Self-Service Tooling, Real-time Streaming and Big Data Solutions for multiple functional areas using modern technologies. The ideal candidate will have experience in a range of the big data space and technologies and stays on top of new development, trends and applies data engineering and science into the marketing and sales organization.

Responsibility

• Work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights using data and ML/AI solution

• Design and build data pipeline for ML/AI that are robust, modular, scalable, deployable, reproducible, and versioned

• Manage data infrastructure to source and curate data from disparate sources using appropriate engineering methodologies, computational frameworks and systems; and improve accessibility, efficiency, governance, processing, and quality of data

• Identify innovative ways to source & leverage data to support modeling efforts and to scale, optimize, and refactor existing tools and workflows

• Subject matter expert to leadership for technical guidance around data and analytics solution design and best practices.

• Improve speed to market by focusing on current data needs as well as building out the long-term strategic data solutions using modern data technologies

Qualification

• Advanced degree in Computer Science, Information system

• Strong programming skills; proficient in Python / R / SQL

• Proven experience building data pipelines in production for advanced analytics use cases

• Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark or other open source big data tools

• Experience with developing APIs to support public-facing web applications

• Practical experience with UI development, such as R shiny or Python Dash / Bokeh / Jungle or Web app development with Java / CSS / HTML

• Familiar with distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Spark, Dask), cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP), containerization, and analytics libraries (e.g. pandas, NumPy, matplotlib)

• Experience with real-time data streaming tools like Kafka, Kinesis, Apache Storm or any similar tools.

• Practical knowledge of software engineering concepts and best practices, inc. DevOps, DataOps, and MLOps would be considered a plus

• Strong sense of ownership and master hands-on technical work

• Continuously learn to maintain strong knowledge of technology enablers

item.description:

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Are you someone who is passionate about data? Group Functions Data Office is seeking a Lead Data Engineer to join the team, reporting to the AVP, Chief Data Officer of Group Functions.  Located in Toronto, Canada the role will (1) champion and support strategic &/or global data initiatives that strengthens Manulife’s global data and advanced analytic capabilities, (2) foster cross-segment collaboration and communication helping build an agile data insight driven culture, and (3) lead and nurture open data design and architecture establishing conditions for successful technical and analytic innovation.

This job description does not represent a comprehensive listing of job duties that are required of the employee performing this role.  We reserve the right to change duties or assign additional duties at any time with or without notice. People Leader Role: No

Job Description

Manulife has a clear vision for a Global Data Strategy.  By liberating and strengthening Manulife’s data capabilities we will enable deeper insights, better product and service design, and more effective business processes.  The result will be exceptional experiences for our customers.
 

Key Accountabilities:

Individual Accountabilities:

  • Builds, codes, tests, maintain high quality software Participates in Agile sprints and ceremonies; supports rapid iteration and development
  • Translates user requirements into software requirements
  • Develops, maintains, and tests data pipelines, application framework, infrastructure for data generation; works closely with information architects and Data Scientists
  • Experience initializing and managing cloud platforms:  Azure etc.
  • Accepts and modifies specifications and standards 
  • Builds and codes complex software
  • Manages portions of development project
  • Coaches teammates at lower levels
  • Contributes code across functions
  • Has positive impact to specific organizational entities & understands nature of impact
  • Top contributor and often enables others to contribute as well

 Mandate covers:

  • Leading new & existing Big Data & Azure Cloud technologies contributing to the innovative design, development and management of data analytics labs supporting to increase knowledge and value insight from data
  • Lead and perform technical systems and data flow development in a variety of projects for complex front, middle and back office applications, with a focus on the reporting and analytics environment; the target environment is built on a Microsoft Azure native cloud
  • Perform technical systems and data flow design for small-to-complex sized projects
  • Work with multiple project execution and deployment teams (e.g. Development, Business Analysis, Architecture, Release Management, Information Risk, and Platform & Operations)
  • Work closely with the technical leads and architecture teams, and align solutions that meet the departmental architectural vision
  • Assess the completeness and accuracy of data, identifying gaps in data, provide feedback to business and system owners with guidance and options to obtain missing information
  • Lead design, build and implement modern data architectures in development and production environments (data orchestration pipelines, data sourcing, cleansing, augmentation and quality control processes)
  • Translates business needs into data engineering and architecture solutions
  • Contributes to overall solution, integration and enterprise architectures
  • Build and support deploying machine learning models in development and production environments
  • Provide proactive data ingestion and analysis of large structured and unstructured datasets involving a wide range of systems across Group Functions (i.e., Finance, Marketing, Global Operations, Risk, Human Resources, Audit, Procurement & Communications)
  • Evaluating existing and proposed data models and how to best access and query them as well as existing and proposed data interfaces and how to clearly document them, including specification of data flow models, data flow timing, data mapping, and data transformation rules including data validations and controls
     

Required Knowledge and Skills:

  • Demonstrated 6-10 years of professional experience in related industry experience in working in big data/data management & understanding big data analytic tooling and environments including a University degree and or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent quantitative program
  • Familiarity with agile and DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other approaches to accelerate the delivery of new features
  • Experience in Big Data, Advanced Analytics (ML/AI) and Business Intelligence technologies to support design, build and implementation for advanced analytics and business intelligence reporting;
  • Experience working with Azure Native Cloud Services and Cloudera and/or Hortonworks Hadoop stack
  • Experience with big data processing frameworks and techniques such as HDFS, MapReduce, Syncsort, Sqoop, Oozie, Storage formats (Avro, Parquet), Stream processing (NiFi, Kafka), etc.
  • Understanding of relational and warehousing database technology working with Hadoop and other major databases platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Oracle, SQLServer, Teradata, MySQL, or Postgres)
  • Experience in data technologies and use of data to support software development, advanced analytics and reporting.  Focus on Cloud (Azure), Hadoop-based technologies and programming or scripting languages like Java, Scala, Linux, C++, PHP, Ruby Python, R and SAS.
  • Knowledge regarding different databases such as Hawq/HDB, MongoDB, Cassandra or Hbase.
  • Working knowledge of modern data streaming using Kafka, Apache Spark and data ingestion frameworks: NiFi, Hive and Pig
  • Experience writing complex SQL and NoSQL jobs to analyze data in both traditional DBMS (MS-SQL, Oracle) and Big Data environments (i.e., HADOOP, SPARK, or similar open source and commercial technologies)
  • Knowledge of non-relational (Cassandra, MongoDB) databases preferred
  • Predictive analytics and machine learning experience (scikit-learn, Tensorflow, MLlib, recommendation systems) preferred
  • Experience with integrating to back-end/legacy environments
  • Experience integrating business and technology teams
  • Knowledge and familiarity with machine learning models application and production pipelines
  • Collaborative attitude, willingness to work with team members; able to coach, participate in code reviews, share skills and methods
  • Remains current with emerging technologies, innovations and practices within the data and analytics industry
  • Good organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion
  • Good verbal and written communication; effectively articulates technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes
  • Strong work ethic, results oriented, and accuracy / attention to detail are critical; ability to work in agile or scrum delivery environments
  • Exceptional oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into business & value-focused language. A key requirement is to communicate clearly and consistently keeping stakeholders well-informed of progress and challenges
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, strong business presence with ability to multi-task and effectively deal with competing priorities. Ability to work with minimal or no supervision while performing duties; has the ability and initiative to organize various functions and be a strong team player.
